title: Good game / Bad community
body:
I have played many games so far, but I have never seen such a bad community before in any other game. The League of Legends is a fairly good game but the majority of players are extremely toxic. In almost every game, players fight with one and other. I have never seen a game where people wish cancer or death to others (just because they had a bad game or gave first blood, etc.). 

I started to play League of Legends only because I like team fights and I like games where I can be part of a community. After two weeks, I felt that I became a stressful person and even lost my temper in a couple of games. I have never experienced these feelings before in a game. 

I deleted this game from my computer two days ago and started to play another game. It only has been two days, but I already feel the difference. I, once again, have fun playing a COMPUTER GAME. When I log into my new game, I actually feel relaxed, rather than stressed. I, once again, have fun (as it is supposed to be) in a COMPUTER GAME!. No more of those people who wish cancer to others because of a COMPUTER GAME!. 

My advice to those who feel the same way as I do, is to delete this game and go and play another game (there are so many good games out there). 
Leave those toxic players with each other. Let them have what they deserve. Let them play with players like themselves. After all, the League of Legends is not a game for them but a way of living.

Alternatively, make friends that aren't toxic poopheads in league and always play premade. If you want to play ranked to get rewards etc, play ranked 5s.

There's a massive difference between having a "bad game" and being a bad player.

 You claim that  "In almost every game, players fight with one and other." and "majority of players are extremely toxic." well the common factor in these games is that you're in them. Don't go feeding up a storm consistently in SoloQ then sulk on the boards about the toxicity of OCE.

LoL while has a bad community, yes and so are many many online games, but the worst I have ever had the fortune/misfortune to come across in my life were the ones I played with back on the original Dota.

Now that's some real toxicity.

But true, a game that revolves around competitiveness tends to be ego centric as well, large player population only adds more salt to the injury.

On a side note, what are you playing now after you have deleted your LoL?

The community never wanted pests like you, only real men belong here. It's good you have left.

On a serious note, fair call man, this game brings out the worst in people which have spent RP on it, the only advice I have is to try and get better at the game, so then your team doesn't rage at you, if they do you don't need to react, because there is no point in reacting to some child on a different computer. 

If it makes you feel better they are very depressed individuals without much to do.
